overview: From 2025-08-24 to 2025-08-31, elizaos-plugins/registry had 6 new PRs (5 merged), 0 new issues, and 15 active contributors.

topPRs.title: Add Claude Code GitHub Workflow
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
## ðŸ¤– Installing Claude Code GitHub App

This PR adds a GitHub Actions workflow that enables Claude Code integration in our repository.

### What is Claude Code?

[Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code) is an AI coding agent that can help with:
- Bug fixes and improvements  
- Documentation updates
- Implementing new features
- Code reviews and suggestions
- Writing tests
- And more!

### How it works

Once this PR is merged, we'll be able to interact with Claude by mentioning @claude in a pull request or issue comment.
Once the workflow is triggered, Claude will analyze the comment and surrounding context, and execute on the request in a GitHub action.

### Important Notes

- **This workflow won't take effect until this PR is merged**
- **@claude mentions won't work until after the merge is complete**
- The workflow runs automatically whenever Claude is mentioned in PR or issue comments
- Claude gets access to the entire PR or issue context including files, diffs, and previous comments

### Security

- Our Anthropic API key is securely stored as a GitHub Actions secret
- Only users with write access to the repository can trigger the workflow
- All Claude runs are stored in the GitHub Actions run history
- Claude's default tools are limited to reading/writing files and interacting with our repo by creating comments, branches, and commits.
- We can add more allowed tools by adding them to the workflow file like:

```
allowed_tools: Bash(npm install),Bash(npm run build),Bash(npm run lint),Bash(npm run test)
```

There's more information in the [Claude Code action repo](https://github.com/anthropics/claude-code-action).

After merging this PR, let's try mentioning @claude in a comment on any PR to get started!

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **Chores**
  * Introduced AI-assisted workflows in GitHub.
    * Automatic code reviews on pull requests to flag quality, performance, security, and testing issues.
    * On-demand code generation/analysis triggered by commenting @claude on issues or PRs.
    * Prepared configurable options (models, prompts, allowed tools, skip rules) for future tuning.
  * No user-facing product changes.

<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

topPRs.title: Add AI Gateway Plugin to ElizaOS Registry
topPRs.author: Dexploarer
topPRs.body:
## Summary
â€¢ Add @elizaos-plugins/plugin-aigateway to the plugin registry
â€¢ Universal AI Gateway integration plugin for elizaOS
â€¢ Provides access to 100+ AI models through unified gateways

## Plugin Details
- **Repository**: https://github.com/dexploarer/plugin-aigateway
- **Package**: @elizaos/plugin-aigateway
- **Version**: 1.0.0
- **Features**: Text generation, image generation, embeddings, model listing
- **Supported Gateways**: Vercel AI Gateway, OpenRouter, and custom gateways

## Quality Assurance
âœ… All tests pass (25/25)
âœ… Clean TypeScript build
âœ… Code formatted with prettier
âœ… No console.log statements in production code
âœ… Follows ElizaOS plugin architecture

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

- Documentation
  - Added RSS feed plugin to the Available Plugins list in README.

- Chores
  - Updated registry metadata: added @elizaos-plugins/plugin-rss-feed, @elizaos/plugin-twitter-rss, and @elizaos-plugins/plugin-aigateway.
  - Bumped patch versions for multiple plugins and removed several v1 branch pins.
  - Adjusted supports flags and updated last updated timestamp.
  - Expanded index with mappings for the new plugins.

<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

topPRs.title: Enhance Claude Code review workflow with comprehensive validation
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
## Summary
Enhanced the Claude Code review workflow to provide comprehensive validation for plugin registry contributions:

â€¢ **NPM Package Validation**: Uses `npm view` to verify packages exist before accepting registry entries
â€¢ **GitHub Repository Validation**: Uses `curl` to check repository accessibility and existence  
â€¢ **Registry Format Documentation**: Added clear format requirements and contribution guidelines to README
â€¢ **DRY Implementation**: References README instead of duplicating format rules in workflow
â€¢ **Comprehensive Error Handling**: Provides specific feedback for each validation failure

## Changes Made

### README.md
- Added "Registry Format" section explaining NPM â†’ GitHub mapping structure
- Added "Contributing to the Registry" section with step-by-step instructions
- Emphasized critical requirement: only modify `index.json`
- Made format requirements the single source of truth

### .github/workflows/claude-code-review.yml  
- Added `allowed_tools` for `npm view`, `curl`, and `git ls-remote` commands
- Enhanced validation prompt to check NPM package and GitHub repository existence
- Streamlined workflow to reference README instead of duplicating format details
- Added specific error messages for missing packages/repositories

## Test plan
- [x] Validated existing plugin entries work with NPM and GitHub validation
- [x] Tested non-existent packages return proper error messages
- [x] Verified YAML syntax is valid
- [x] Confirmed workflow references README for DRY compliance

## Benefits
- Prevents broken registry entries from non-existent packages/repositories
- Provides clear, actionable feedback to contributors
- Maintains registry quality automatically
- Reduces manual review overhead

ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **Documentation**
  * Overhauled README with a registry-focused guide: registry format and submission workflow, plugin architecture (v1/v2), development guidelines, environment/secrets, branding requirements, automated registry generation and usage, and manual generation steps.
* **Chores**
  * Updated automated PR review to enforce registry rules: only index.json changes allowed, JSON validity and alphabetical order, no duplicates, and external validation of NPM packages and GitHub repositories, with clear approve/reject actions aligned to contributing guidelines.

<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

topPRs.title: feat: add alphabetical sorting to registry generation
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
## Summary
- Add alphabetical sorting to registry generation process
- Sort entries by key during processing to ensure consistent order
- Sort the final registry output by keys
- Clean up and alphabetically sort index.json
- Remove invalid empty key entries from index.json

## Changes Made
1. **Modified `scripts/generate-registry.js`:**
   - Added sorting of entries by key before processing: `Object.entries(filteredRegistry).sort(([a], [b]) => a.localeCompare(b))`
   - Added sorting of the final report object by keys before returning it

2. **Updated `index.json`:**
   - Alphabetically sorted all keys in the source file
   - Removed invalid empty key entries that were causing issues
   - Verified that all 203 valid entries are now properly ordered

## Benefits
- Ensures consistent, predictable ordering of plugins in the registry
- Makes the registry easier to navigate and maintain
- Provides better user experience when browsing plugins
- Prevents ordering inconsistencies during registry generation

## Test Plan
- [x] Verified index.json is properly sorted alphabetically
- [x] Tested sorting logic in the generation script
- [x] Confirmed all entries are processed correctly
- [x] Validated that the final output maintains alphabetical order

ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

* New Features
  * Added integrations for ATTPs, Action Bench, Cardano, Clanker, DeFiLlama, Lightlink, Reveel PayID, and XMTP.
* Bug Fixes
  * Made registry generation deterministic by sorting entries and output, ensuring stable, predictable ordering.
* Chores
  * Removed legacy plugin references and deprecated adapter/client/bootstrap entries.

<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
